item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Friday, March 14, 2025 at 8:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Samsung Q990D unresponsive after 1020 firmware update (457 points | 364 comments)
2. Decrypting encrypted files from Akira ransomware using a bunch of GPUs (42 points | 3 comments)
3. Kerning, the Hard Way (10 points | discuss)

7. East Asian personality may stem from Ice Age Siberia 20000 yrs ago (25 points | 4 comments)
8. Briar: Peer to Peer Encrypted Messaging (85 points | 30 comments)

10. Block Diffusion: Interpolating Between Autoregressive and Diffusion Models (79 points | 19 comments)
11. Bluesky quickly sold out of the T-shirt its CEO wore to troll Mark Zuckerberg (36 points | 13 comments)

13. Prequel (YC W21) Is Hiring a Strong Front End Engineer ( | hide)
14. Apparently magpies and crows are using “anti-bird spikes” to make nests (2023) (178 points | 67 comments)

16. In S3 simplicity is table stakes (136 points | 87 comments)

18. Why do transit agencies keep falling for the hydrogen bus myth? (54 points | 73 comments)
19. The Internet of Beefs (2020) (10 points | 1 comment)
20. My Scammer Girlfriend: Baiting a Romance Fraudster (344 points | 128 comments)

22. Making Postgres scale (69 points | 76 comments)
23. Show HN: CodeVideo – Two years in the making to build an event-sourced IDE (52 points | 17 comments)
24. AMD's Strix Halo under the hood (132 points | 106 comments)
25. The Cassowary Linear Arithmetic Constraint Solving Algorithm [pdf] (2002) (41 points | 14 comments)
26. Chrome for Android doesn't have extensions, but Edge now has a whole store (31 points | 19 comments)
27. Y Combinator urges the White House to support Europe's Digital Markets Act (453 points | 335 comments)
28. TinyKVM: Fast sandbox that runs on top of Varnish (297 points | 53 comments)
29. Stoicism's appeal to the rich and powerful (2019) (142 points | 215 comments)
